comment.text: Link exchange is nothing else except it is just placing the other person’s blog link on your page at proper place and other person will also do similar in favor of you.
YUMMY! These looks fantastic and I’m the same way about spice!
Love all that cheese and the spicy jalapeño, the green color is also so vibrant and nice!
Oh man I could get in trouble with these guys!! They look so perfect for a party or girls wine night!! Yum!!
Hi Ashley! I usually eat so many appetizers around the holidays that I don’t have much room left for dinner! I make a baked jalapeno popper that is wrapped in, what else, bacon and I always...
I totally agree! Finger food is so fun and way less stress!
I have never had jalapeño poppers either! But that changes today because these little cupcakes look delicious.
Wow, these looks amazing!! I’m typically not one for much spice either, so I love that these are adjustable in terms of heat. These look like one delicious appetizer
What an amazing looking appetizer, Ashely. I love spices, and JALAPENO POPPER CUPCAKES look so vibrant, delicious and flavorful.
This looks like a nice little recipe however I am missing the jalapeño part???? How can you call them Jalapeño poppers when there are no jalapeno’s in it?? Yes it has cream cheese but…….!
My bad — I mentioned the jalapenos in the post and forgot to include them when I wrote out the recipe! It’s fixed now — thanks for pointing that out!
I think I’ve only had a jalapeno popper once in my life and I was pleasantly surprised that it wasn’t super hot. I also don’t cook with jalapenos much because I am such a wimp when it...
Thanks Isadora! I hope you had a great Christmas too!
These look ah-mazing!! I am definitely on board with bacon and cheese, no worries there Pinned!
Thanks Denise!
These look so yummy. The chicken jalapeno combination sounds perfect. Where would I find Wonton wrappers? I’ve never used them for anything so far, and I don’t know where to look.
You can find them in the refrigerated section by the salads and such — at least thats where I find them in my grocery store. Hope that helps!
Wow these look amazing! I love jalapeno poppers so this is the perfect combo for me!
Thanks Kelley!
What a perfect appetizer for New Years Eve! I love jalapeno poppers, so I know I’d love these. They look so good in the wonton wrappers!
Thanks Amy!
Yum! You’ve GOT to try jalapeno poppers. They’re actually not terribly spicy because of the mild cream cheese Merry Christmas!
Thanks Medha! You too!
These look delicious! I love all the flavors you’ve put into these little cupcakes.
Thanks Amy!
Ooooh you should absolutely try a jalapeno popper Ashley! They are SO good! I’m already excited about eating them again once I stop breastfeeding my baby And uhm, bacon and cheese? GIMME...
Thanks Nora! I feel like they would be so spicy, I’m kind of a wuss! But it’s easy to control the spice in these so I really enjoyed them
I’m one of those 99% and I personally want to comfort those who are in that 1% … with a plate of these because how could anyone not want these?! Appetizers are usually my favorite part...
Thanks Mary Frances! I love appetizers too but hardly ever make them. We definitely ate these for dinner! Lol
I am definitely one of the 99%. Bring on the cheese and bacon ANYTIME and all the time. These little cups are just beyond cute and I love how much goodness they hold! I could definitely see...
Thanks Sarah!
Oh these look incredibly good! Love the chicken and jalapeno flavour, so good! Definitely craving a few of these right now!
Thanks Jessica! Definitely a meal in one
These are amazing, love all the flavor you packed n these!
Thanks Amanda!
Love that you added bbq sauce! What a delicious appetizer!
Thanks Christin! Pretty much ny favorite condiment. Lol
The more bacon and cheese the better! I love that you made these into little cupcakes, what a fun idea. I’ve been on the search for some fun appetizers for our New Year’s party. I’ll...
Thanks Danielle! I find it kind of hard to make an appetizer without cheese and bacon… Lol. Maybe I need to expand my horizons!
We are huge spice lovers and can’t get enough of jalapeno poppers.. I love that you made them into these adorable cupcakes, that is such a great idea! So fun and poppable!
Thanks Kelly! I might just have to try the real deal sometime
I love spicy food, so these look fantastic! And I love that you added chicken and BBQ sauce, that sounds like the perfect appetizer!
Thanks Stacey!
Love jalapeño poppers, they are the best. I love your version too, Ashley! Very creative.
Thanks Shinee!
Mmmm these look amazing!! I could totally go for a whole plate right now! Pinned!
Thanks Christina!
So fun Ashley! My kids would gobble these up in no time! Pinned. Have a wonderful week!
Thanks Melanie! You too!
I think we all went way overboard with the Christmas baking recipes!! hey, it’s our job! and love that you are bringing us an appetizer recipe today!! Cheers to your husband for picking this...
Thanks Alice! He did pick a good one! Lol
What a creative appetizer, Ashley! I’m loving these jalapeno popper cupcakes! I’m actually not a fan of spicy foods either, but these sound fantastic. So perfect for a holiday snack!
Thanks Gayle!

wpheader.description: Low Carb. Gluten Free. Delicious

recipe.name: Easy Balsamic Beef Pot Roast
recipe.author: Mellissa Sevigny
recipe.ingredients: One boneless chuck roast, approximately 3 lbs.
recipe.recipeinstructions: Season the Chuck roast with salt, pepper, and garlic powder on both sides.
recipe.description: This super easy and delicious low carb beef pot roast recipe can be made on the stove, in the slow cooker, or even in your Instant Pot! Keto, Atkins and Paleo friendly!

comment.text: this looks yummy! And, don’t you have a big beastie family member who packs a gun and know karate stay at your house when you go out of town? *wink* *wink* ;)
I lways put veggies in my pot roast pan and bake it in the oven. That way they get all the flavorings too. Garlic, celery, carrots, turnips, celery, whole shrooms, brussel sprouts; maybe rutabaga,...
I don’t disagree Helene but I do like the pure, rich flavor of this version and without the extra veggies in the mix it’s easier to count the carbs for the gravy as well! But yes to all...
Do you change your Instant Pot setting from Saute to Low or High Pressure for the 35 minutes? This looks so good. Can’t wait to try it. Thanks! Have fun on vacation!
Yes – sorry if that wasn’t clear! My instant pot I set to Manual and then plug in the 35 minutes. If you have the option to set the pressure I’d go with high!
I’m making this right now (my first IP dish ever). I followed the steps but after 35 minutes on high pressure it’s tough and still mostly pink in the middle. Based on your pictures I was...
haha.. re-covered.. it’s yet to be determined if I actually recovered. ;)
It’s still tough :( . I’m going for another 15 minutes. Anyone?
I also always set my electric pressure cooker on high whenever I’m doing a beef roast such as this. I am old fashioned of German heritage so I use contained-in-a-tea-mesh pickling spice for...
Sauerbraten is a great idea Judith, might make one myself soon too!!!
Can you sub something for xantham gum? I’m allergic. Or skip it?
You can use arrowroot or another thickener – or skip it and it will be thinner, but just as good!
You could always add some butter!! This sounds awesome!
Can I ask a question about the xanthan gum? I’ve not used it to thicken sauces before, the first time I tried I just dropped a teaspoon in my soup and whisked, after a minute of vigorous...
Maybe because the popper soup was so thick and it had nothing to dissolve into – not sure Gayle, whisking usually does the trick for me! It might have been the brand you are using though...
Thanks Melissa, the brand I’m using is Bob’s Red Mill. I’ll have to try hardworking next time.
The trick with xanthan is to use just a tiny bit (more like 1/8 or 1/4 of a teaspoon – a whole teaspoon would be make it uber thick), and it mixes best with a bit of fat. The liquid from...
Mary Ann, I tried your suggested sprinkling technique and it worked a treat, thank you for suggesting it!
yay! glad to hear. :)
I don’t think robbers eat low carb or gluten free. You should be fine.
You know, I didn’t think of that but you’re probably right! I guess I don’t need to booby trap the front door now…
How long would you think to cook this in the crockpot ? Sounds so yummy , I can’t wait to try it!
4 hours on high should do it!
Have a fantastic trip :) I love Belize.
Thanks Jeanette! It will be our first time there and we are really excited about it!
Love your site and getting your emails. Can I use a dutch oven and then bake? If yes, how long? Thanks!
Yes! Sear the meat, then add the liquids and bring to a boil, then cover and bake at 350 for about 4 hours or until the meat is tender!
I do my pot roasts in the oven (in a dutch oven tightly covered) at 350*F, for 2.5 to 3 hours, depending on how thick it is. That’s for a 3 lb. chuck roast. It always comes out perfecto!
Hope you enjoy the trip and thanks for sharing this recipe, the beef looks tender!
This looks excellent. I’m going to add this to next week’s menu !
This looks yummy even though I’m not looking for low carb. I don’t have xanthan gum. How much cornstarch or flour would do the trick? Thanks so much!
Also, I’ve started following you on Pinterest because all your recipes look so good! I watch my carbs, even though I can’t say I’m really DOING low carb!
1 Tbsp of cornstarch mixed into some of the liquid and then poured back in should do it Karen!
Thank you so much! I’ll be trying this soon. The first of many of your recipes I will be making.
Hopefully you’ll enjoy it and it won’t be the last! ;)
Yeah! I’m so excited that you got an Instant Pot! I love love love mine and I love when other people make amazing recipes for it! Happy Vacation!
I 2nd that, Cristina! So happy to see the low-carb recipe with Instant Pot directions. I LOVE my Instant Pot so much that I bought a 2nd one! I use it for as many recipes as possible. Thank...
So sorry, Mellissa that I spelled your name wrong!
No problem Toria, I don’t know what my mother was thinking with the 2 ll’s – most have just one so it gets misspelled all the time and I’m used to it! :)
It is SO much nicer to have the electric pressure cookers like Instant Pot!! I grew up with the old ones and one time, when we entered the house and the door banged a bit hard, dinner ended...
Can I use a regular (non electronic) pressure cooker? I don’t have an electronic. Same time? By the way – Mellissa, love you! So many great recipes and entertaining introductions! My gut...
Christine, This isn’t my blog but you can use the old style pressure cooker and depending on what the weight of the pressure element is, 10 or 15 pounds, the heavier it is, the less time...
How about the crockpot? Or do you think it would somehow not be as flavorful?
Does this freeze well?

usercomments.commenttext: I adore Banh Mi! Of course I worked near Little Saigon so I had them often. Love the idea of pairing it with Bratwurst. Saw this on Tickle My Tastebuds
OMG, Lauren! Bánh Mì is EVERYTHING and I am SOOOOO in love with your bratwurst spin!! Genius and absolutely perfect for football season (or any season!!)! Pinned! Cheers, my sweets! :)
Haha, thanks so much lady! What football team do you cheer for?
Wow, these bratwurst sandwiches are an awesome idea! I love how you mixed up a traditional bratwurst, and sandwich! Definitely want to try this!
Thanks so much Shelby! Let me know what you think if you end up making them! :)
I can’t show my boyfriend these…I know he’ll want them every night! Yum! Thanks for sharing :)
Haha, they are SUPER easy to make so if that was the case it might not be such a bad thing! Enjoy!
Which wp theme are you using on your website? Is it from these guys by any chance: http://www.nuttythemes.com
I use the Foodie Pro Theme!
I was just commenting on missing the Vietnamese restaurant I used to walk to when I lived just outside of Washington, DC. I hope this will help to ease that!
It’s so hard to move away from good restaurants! I totally understand how that is. I hope you enjoy this recipe Steph! :) Thanks for stopping by!
I have never heard of Banh Mi but this looks awesome!
Oh you’re in for a real treat then Lara! Banh Mi is one of my favorite kinds of sandwiches. :)

recipe.name: Bánh Mì Bratwurst
recipe.recipeinstructions: Grill the bratwursts. Place each one in a bun and top with a cucumber spear, some carrots, jalapeño slices and sriracha mayo. Additional toppings ideas (optional): cilantro, soy sauce, daikon.

blogposting.headline: Bánh Mì Bratwurst
blogposting.text: Two summers ago, I had my first-ever Bánh Mì experience at Jasmine Deli, a little restaurant on Eat Street in Minneapolis. It was love at first bite. What exactly is a bánh mì? It’s Vietnames...

items.title: Dessert Cups

metatags.og:description: In double boiler over hot water, melt 2 cups of wafers. Cool about 5 mins.  Inﬂate balloons to 4” diameter; knot. Holding balloons by knot, dip into melted product, tipping to cover balloon halfway up. Place balloon, knotted side up, on wax paper-lined baking sheet, holding balloon in place until it starts to set. Repeat with remaining balloons to make 8 cups. Place in freezer 5 mins. Melt remaining 2 cup of wafers and repeat dipping procedure; place in freezer for 10 mins.  Snip hole in each balloon to deﬂate; carefully peel away from dessert cups. Refrigerate until needed. Use the same day.  Fill cups with ice cream, sorbet, mousse or fresh fruit such as raspberries or strawberries into dessert cups.    FOR MOUSSE    In double boiler over hot water, melt white chips with liqueur and water; stir gently to blend. Cool until melted white chips mixture no longer feels warm to the touch. comment.text: What a spectacular stew, Christie! Perfect on Christmas Eve and ALL winter long!
Thanks Liz. We enjoyed this so much.
This is one of my favorite meals, any time of the year! But so perfect for Christmas Eve and the Feast of the Seven Fishes. Thank you for being a part of our virtual dinner party, Christie!
It was my pleasure Lora. I enjoyed learning more about the Feast of Seven Fishes. Plus we have a seafood stew we can enjoy all the time.
I LOVE the look of this dish! Your photos are so cool with the bread and herbs strewn around. I had something like this at a restaurant once and have always wanted to recreate it.
Hi Katie, This is one of my favorite dishes to eat at a restaurant but it is also really easy to make at home.
Christie, this stew looks wonderful! My husband would be all over it, seafood is his favorite.
Thanks Heather. I will be making this recipe again and again. I think it will be our Valentine’s dinner.
Tuscan Seafood Stew looks so decadent and delicious and that it could be low calorie also puts it over the top. I’ll definitely be making this over the Christmas holidays. Thank you!
Thanks Linda. Seafood is naturally low calorie so it was really simple to make a healthy recipe for it.
Christie, this is absolutely gorgeous…and hands-down my favorite kind of food. Brothy soup packed with seafood…I want to reach in and grab that bowl in a bad way. Peasant food always seems...
Hi Heather, I loved learning about the origins of this dish. We tend to think of seafood as expensive in this country. It really put a different spin on it for me.
My seafood loving family will totally enjoy this! Perfect for the cold weather and love that not only is it tasty but it’s low-cal and very healthy, too!
Thanks Abby.
This dish looks amazing! I love seafood, and would eat a whole big pot of this stew in one sitting, I fear It looks like the perfect blend of flavors!
Luckily you can eat a lot for a little calories Marlynn.
I so want to make this! I’m actually salivating, just looking at the picture! This is a perfect addition to the Feast of the Seven Fishes! Love this dish!
Thanks Christina. It is really easy to make. I will happily be making it time and time again.
So beautiful! Wish we could have a big potluck dinner.
Me too Lisa. What a feast we would have.
That broth! I just want to take a big hunk of bread and sop it all up so I wouldn’t miss one drop. After I eat all that delicious seafood of course.
Oh yes! Soaking up the broth with bread is one of my favorite parts to this meal.
This is beautiful and sounds so delicious! I have yet to make anything with clams in their shell. I’ve been a little intimidated. This looks ridiculously good!
Cooking with clams in their shell is so easy Karen. You will wonder why you waited. It also happens to be my 9year olds favorite meal.
Christie this is such a lovely recipe. My dad was from the east coast so seafood and fish were things we grew up being very exposed to. I knew what seafood stew and corn chowder were when I...
It would be so much fun to get together to enjoy the entire feast. They great thing about this stew is that you can use whatever seafood you like. Load up on the fish and forget the shellfish....
Oh my, such a beautiful dish, I am not a clam eater but love the broth, I’ll just add more shrimp.
You can easily make this dish with whatever seafood you like Amy.
What a stew, and what a recipe round up! I’d make this multi-course meal any time of year!
Thanks Dee Dee
Mmm, this sounds good. I’ve been reading about feast of 7 fishes recently, sounds like a fun idea.
I can imagine what fun the Feast of Seven Fishes is with a large family.
Soup or stew, doesn’t matter, I just call it delicious. You’ve included everything I love, I would have to have those scallops too! Beautiful photos!
Thanks Barb. I could eat this stew happily every week.
Thankyou for giving new light on a fish stew this looks so fresh. colourful and so yummy….. Stew give you this picture in your mind of grey over cooked everything and have never had a Fish...
I hope you enjoy it Lindi. The big tip is not to overcook the seafood. Please let me know when you make it. I would love your feedback. Christie

items.title: Maple Pork Tenderloin | Weelicious

hrecipe.summary: We don't eat a lot of meat in our house, but pork tenderloin is one of my personal favorites that I am always happy to make an exception for. As you can imagine, I grew up eating quite a bit...

metatags.twitter:description: We don't eat a lot of meat in our house, but pork tenderloin is one of my personal favorites that I am always happy to make an exception for. As you can imagine, I grew up eating quite a bit of it growing up in Kentucky, and I still crave it today.    This maple pork tenderloin recipe is so tender, sweet and saves time because it is perfect to make ahead of time. I love whipping up a few batches of it, placing it in zipper bags and freezing it, so that whenever I feel like making it I just pop it in the refrigerator in the morning to defrost and then bake it or grill it that night -- with very little clean up.    I knew all the adults would fall in love with this dish at a Sunday night dinner we hosted recently, but I wasn't so sure about Kenya. Sometimes I find that toddlers don't have the patience to eat meat because it takes so much time for them to chew. But what a pleasant surprise for me: I just cut it into tiny pieces and he ate them all up. A boy after my own heart.

items.title: Main-Dish Lentil-Vegetable Soup Recipe | Vegetarian Times

metatags.og:description: This flavorful soup with its protein-rich lentils is substantial enough to enjoy as a main dish. One note: Even though most lentils today are picked clean, sort through them just in case to remove any debris.    If you’re pinched for time, skip the initial sauté that starts the soup; however, those few extra minutes (and the 1 extra pan it takes) greatly enhance the overall flavor. To add some greens with no extra cooking, chop some baby spinach, and stir it in just before serving. The heat from the soup will just wilt the spinach.   Main-Dish Lentil-Vegetable Soup, 4.0 out of 4 based on 1 rating

Such beautiful photos. I love the colors in this dish. I can just imagine all the flavors. Thanks for the great tip about stirring in the pesto and tomato at the end to preserve the colors....
Love one pot meals! Your recipe is so simple and I bet super delicious! Love the pesto in the rice.
Love those easy but so delicious and full of flavor chicken dinners!
This is my favorite kind of dinner – easy, comforting and delicious. Adding pesto and parmesan is such a great touch – love it!
I am with you on chicken thighs — the BEST part of the bird. This looks astoundingly good!
I adore risotto but, like you, don’t always have the time to watch over it. This is the perfect solution! What a beautiful weeknight or entertaining meal.
I am happy that we can use the oven now as it’s starting to get a little colder. This vibrant and delicious one-pot-chicken dish is the perfect way to end summer! Looks so good! Pinned.

One pot meals are a lifesaver. That tomato basil risotto is such a great addition to a weeknight chicken dinner.
One pot meals are the best! This one is definitely going on the fall menu…it looks delicious! Pinning!
I’ve not made a baked chicken dish in a while. I’ll have to start with this one, loving all of those flavors and the simplicity! oxox
I love that you’ve made a one dish meal with risotto. This is definitely going on my must-make list! Pinned!

I love one pot meals, and this one looks like a real winner! I know my husband and I would absolutely love this – adding it to the menu for this fall!

items.title: {One Pot} Pizza Pasta | Chelsea's Messy Apron

comment.text: Pizza, one pot, pasta? All those words have the making of the best sentence to ever happen to my taste buds! Love this girl! Pinning!
That looks and sounds SO good! I love that you used pizza sauce
We’ve got pasta on the brain. I’ve got one posted on my blog too. This one is definitely kid friendly. I can see the whole family chowing down on this dish! Have a beautiful Wednesday!
Wow this sounds like such a great idea! much better than a frozen pizza!
Wow! So I can have 2 of my fave comfort foods all at the same time! Pure genius Chelsea. Pure freaking genius!
LOVE this idea! So comforting, and looks like a ton of flavor!
ummm YES! that is all that needs to be said over this!!!!!
Yay for more one pot meals! Pizza pasta sounds like the perfect combination of two of the best things. Pinned and can’t wait to make this soon!
Definitely sounds better than frozen pizza! Love the gooey cheese
I just made pizza pasta too! Yours is much healthier and veggie-er. Want!
I love recipes with any take on pizza! Pinned!
Pizza, pasta, one pot? Umm yes please! I love all the veggies you used – I am a big veggies on my pizza girl! And such a perfect weeknight meal!
Love how customizable it is! Pizza AND pasta are sure fire kid pleasers! Yes to all those veggies hidden in there!
What a great twist on the usual pizza and I love that it’s all made in one pot!
Infinitely better than frozen pizza, and I’m willing to bet it’s right on par with fresh as well. Looks awesome Chelsea.
Pizza and pasta together in one pot??? Count me in! This looks amazing and I love all the veggies in here too – this would make a perfect weeknight meal that the whole family will love – pinning
My favorite part of this, is putting the cover on, and relaxing!! This does seem uber easy to make!! Kind of a genius idea Chelsea. I like that you added garlic too, next time I make anything...
Oh my gosh, that picture with the melty cheese! I love pizza and I love pasta, so I’m sort of freaking out that you put them together in one dish! Totally better than frozen pizza. Pinned!
You can’t go wrong with anything pizza – no matter how you make it! I love that this is a one pot dish!! Less to clean up!
What a great twist to pizza! Love how versatile it is!
You’re killing me here, Chelsea! I fell in love with this dish the moment I saw it on instagram. You can never. ever have enough one pot meal recipes! Can’t wait to make this soon!
This is a genius idea. I love it. I also hand shred all my cheese. It might make me a cheese snob, but I’m cool with that.
Those photos have be drooling…ugh, I want pizza now! But, I`m sure this will do!
I’m certainly enjoying going through your recipes, this looks fantastic and I love how it’s a one pan dish, less washing up!

items.title: Meta Given's Pumpkin Pie Recipe on Food52
items.htmlTitle: Meta Given's Pumpkin Pie Recipe on Food52

metatags.sailthru.author: Genius Recipes
metatags.og:description: Caramelizing the pumpkin puree means that this is a pie with guts, one that won't just sit there phoning in the pumpkin flavor, burying it under lots of spice. But its genius is much more than that. You don't have to blind bake the crust. You use real milk and cream instead of evaporated milk, with predictably better results. And because you blast it at 400 degrees the whole time, it bakes in 25 minutes -- less than half the time of your average back-of-the-can recipe. From Meta Given's Modern Encyclopedia of Cooking, an underrated gem of a cookbook.

comment.text: Holy yum! As for Netflix, have you guys tried Psych or Merlin? Both fun, clean shows!
No I haven’t, thank you so much for the recommendations! I am adding them to my queue!
I am soo going to be a dream maker. These mini pies look so tasty, Jen!! I just love chocolate and peanut butter treats.
Me too! Chocolate and peanut butter are the best! Thanks so much Lisa!
I made these a couple weeks ago for my book club group. So so yummy! The cinnamon really stands out, but in a good way. They do get soft pretty quick, so eat them as soon as you can after taking...
Hi Stacie, I am so happy you and your book club enjoyed these – what a fun dessert to bring! Thank you!
I just made these and am super excited for them to be ready to come out of the oven. Thanks for sharing!
Hope you love them!
Do you have a calorie count on these babies? They are AWESOME !!!
Thanks Amanda! I haven’t done a calorie count on them but you can get that by going to http://www.myfitnesspal.com/recipe/calculator
thankyou for sharing
You are so welcome!!
These look amazing! I just did everything but the ganache and they’re in the freezer now! Question though–do you leave the cupcake liners on until serving and let the eaters peel them off?...
Hi Sara! Sorry I have been out of town and am just seeing your question. Because these soften so quickly, I leave the cupcake wrappers while adding the ganache then either you or the eaters...
Drooling.. They look gorgeous and lovely combo . WIsh I could grab one right now
Thank you so much Kushi! I wish I could give one to you!!
I made these for the family and everyone loved them. I am not a fan of semisweet chocolate so I think next time I will use milk chocolate. I also used Heath toffee bits. I kept them in the...
Hi Jonelle, I am so happy to hear everyone loved them! and I am sure they would be delicious with dark chocolate as well – yum! Thanks!!
These mini peanut butter pies look so good! Hoping to make them this week. I was wondering if they can be frozen and stored for a bit. I plan on making as an additional dessert for Thanksgiving...
Absolutely! I would actually freeze all of them and then only remove the ones you are going to eat when serving as they soften quickly. The rest will should stay good in the freezer for quite...
Hi, these look AMAZING. I love peanut butter pie but can hardly find ones I want to try but these I want to make for Thanksgiving! I was wondering if I could use all the same ingredients but...
Hi Tiffany, you can definitely leave out the toffee and keep the measurements the same and they will still be delicious. Enjoy and have a Happy Thanksgiving!
Toffee and graham is my second favorite flavor combination and peanut butter chocolate is obviously my favorite. These are a must make for me! Great idea!
Thank you so much Carolyn! We must be foodie taste bud soul mates! I hope you love these!!
Can this be made in a tart pan? instead of small individual ones?
Hi Jillian, yes that should be just fine, enjoy!
I made these mini pies this weekend with Butterfinger pieces and they are yummy!! Mine do not get too soft when left in the refrigerator. Thanks for sharing.
butterfinger is my fav – LOVE that addition! You are so welcome Sherry, thank YOU for commenting :)!
I have graham crackers crumbs in my cupboard so how many would I use to equal 5 whole graham crackers?
Hi Karrin, the easiest way to make these with graham cracker crumbs is to measure out a heaping tablespoon for each muffin cup – so 12 heaping tablespoons crumbs. Hope this helps!

metatags.og:description: Conventional wisdom says that salads should be dressed with vinaigrettes, which, by definition, balance an acid with a fat. article.description: Don't let the holiday cocktail parties slow down your health goals. Hummus is a tasty and healthy option to serve or bring to your next holiday party, or to

metatags.twitter:description: Hummus is a tasty and healthy option to serve at your next holiday party, or to have any day of the week as a nutritious snack, spread, or dressing for a side dish. Get maximum nutrition with this middle-eastern favorite for only 50 calories per serving (2 Tbsp.), 1.5 g protein, 1-2 g fiber, 1 g of healthy fats and a good source of important vitamins and minerals!  Test out personalized homemade versions and be on your way to a new favorite healthy holiday snack that doesn’t involve heavy cream or sugar! Health benefits of hummus:  Rich in Healthy Fats: High in mono and polyunsaturated fats, hummus helps to lower blood cholesterol and provides protective cell, brain, and heart health functions. High in Fiber: Fiber helps you feel full, aids in digestion, and can help regulate blood sugars allowing hummus to be beneficial for weight loss and serve as a diabetic-friendly snack: 1/3 cup provides 4 g fiber, helping you meet your 25 g per day recommendation. Good source of Folate, Iron,

items.title: Three Bean Vegetarian Chili - Recipes | Pampered Chef US Site
items.htmlTitle: Three Bean Vegetarian Chili - Recipes | Pampered Chef US Site

metatags.og:recipeinstructions: Heat oil in Rockcrok Dutch Oven or Executive (4-qt.) Casserole over medium-high heat 1-3 minutes or until shimmering. Add bell peppers, onion, garlic, chili powder and cumin; cook until vegetables are crisp-tender, about 5 minutes. Add tomatoes, beans and corn; mix well. Bring to a boil; reduce heat and simmer, covered, 45 minutes, stirring occasionally. Ladle chili into soup bowls. Serve with toppings, if desired.
metatags.title: Three Bean Vegetarian Chili - Recipes | Pampered Chef US Site
metatags.og:name: Three Bean Vegetarian Chili
metatags.og:description: Find delicious and easy recipes perfect for any occasion. Browse PamperedChef.com for more recipe ideas and new kitchen products. Get inspired today!
metatags.og:ingredients: 2 teaspoons (10 mL) vegetable oil 2 cups (500 mL) chopped green bell pepper 2 cups (500 mL) chopped red bell pepper 1 cup (250 mL) chopped onion 4 garlic cloves, pressed 1 tablespoon (15 mL) chili powder 3/4 teaspoon (4 mL) ground cumin 2 cans (14.5 ounces/450 g each) diced tomatoes, undrained 1 can (15.5 ounces/450 g) mild chili beans in sauce, undrained 1 can (15.5 ounces/450 g) pinto beans, drained and rinsed 1 can (15 ounces/450 g) black beans, drained and rinsed 1 can (7 ounces/200 g) whole kernel corn, drained null Toppings such as shredded cheddar cheese, sour cream and snipped fresh cilantro (optional)

metatags.og:description: Slow cooker meals are a lot of things, but they certainly aren’t elegant.  They might be delicious, of course they’re easy,  they make your kitchen smell insane. and they make you feel all warm and fuzzy inside, but they aren’t what anyone would call fancy.  And that’s ok.  When you’re hungry after a long day you don’t need fancy.  I’ve been thinking a lot about slow cookers lately.  I’ve had one for years, but honestly it doesn’t get that much use.  Most of my cooking is done from fresh ingredients in a pretty quick manner, and I don’t [...]

comment.commenttext: This stew looks so hearty and delicious. Love!! I really enjoy making dishes like this over the weekend, so I can have leftovers for the week. Perhaps I’ll make this tomorrow :)!
I really like that you cut the vegetables into varying shapes and sizes. I’ll be doing that in the future! The stew looks delicious. I wish I could have been hanging around your house while...
Thanks, Christiane, the aroma was exquisite!
Having a Le Creuset dutch oven is certainly on my wish list! Winter stews are the best and a quality dutch oven makes them easy to let simmer for hours.
I agree, Brandy, and I love that you can use them for a long slow simmer on the stovetop or in the oven.
The enameled 8 QT Dutch ovens I’ve had only lasted about 3 years before the enamel started coming off the inside…The first one was a Le Creuset, the 2nd was a Martha Stewart. I replaced...
Oh my goodness this looks rich and good. I was reading the recipe, and have never tried the 24-hour marination at room temp. I’m ready to do it! I do wonder, though, when to add the beef...
This stew looks so good, definitely one of my favorite cold weather meals!
Such a beautiful meal, and it looks so comforting!
I have a Le Creuset with the same color and love using it all the time!! This delicious and hearty beef stew is the perfect dish to cook in it! Perfect comfort food for winter!
The french do know how to make a great stew. Probably because they aren’t afraid of fat. This is a gorgeous stew, I bet your house smells amazing while you are making it!
OMG, I just want to dive right in! And I just bought a dutch oven… can’t wait to test it out with this recipe! :D
This stew sounds & looks so rich & flavorful! :) I LOVE that red wine marinade. And it is such a nice change to use the turnips, parsnips, & rutabagas instead of the usual potatoes & carrots.
What an incredibly gorgeous stew!! I’ll bet my stew hating husband (crazy right??) will absolutely love this one!! I love how you wrapped the herbs in the leek and also your idea of different...
This is absolutely stunning. I love beef stew but always find it hard to photograph. You nailed it. This is so beautiful. I dig that you used such fabulous root veggies. I grew up eating all...
I love beef stew, and yours looks heavenly. Perfect for this cold, wet weather we’re having in Portland.
This stew is perfect for winter. So meaty and delicious…I want a bowl now!
I can almost smell it! And I love that orange Creuset!
Oh I have to try this, sounds delicious, I think my I pad has smell a vision. Your beautiful photos make me want to cook every thing you make. Tell me that you are writing a cookbook in the...
Thanks so much for your generous compliments, Sue, I appreciate them :) I was actually offered a cookbook deal just a few months ago and had the contract in hand ready to sign but told them...
I have a Le Creuset Dutch oven (just like yours) that was passed down from my grandparents, and it is one of the most treasured things in my kitchen! This stew looks like the perfect thing...
A big bowl of this stew, a loaf of crusty bread, a bottle (or box) of wine and a big spoon would make me a very happy girl!!
And the best part of about it, Judy, is that all of that’s very easy to arrange! :) Here’s to Happiness!
Or maybe your grandSON will inherit it! This looks fantastic! It’s freezing cold these days, the perfect time to try this.
That browned beef is the only way to make a GREAT stew!! And those rustic veggies totally make this so comforting!!
I agree 100%, Megan!

comment.text: If I substituted pearl barley for the rice, would there be any changes in the time, etc?
Hi Ann – I would pre-cook the pearl barley for about 20 minutes first. Otherwise your potatoes and carrots are going to be mush.
Oh, OK. I think I’ll stick with the rice~ You are my “go to” person for anything pressure cooker related. I am 70 years old and this is the first time I have ever used a pressure cooker,...
That’s so great Ann! I’m hope I’m as adventurous at 70. Have fun!
I love a hearty, delicious meal. I made this but used brown rice, added the peas, and beef stock. Those were my adjustments and it turned out wonderfully. Thanks for sharing.
Did you cook it longer with the brown rice?
My family loved the recipe.. We made this tonight! OMGosh!!! It is so YUMMY!!!
Thanks Andrew! Glad it was a hit
I’ve already made this twice this week, Thanks for posting!
Do you think it’d be possible to double this and still have it fit in a 6qt? we’re feeding a family of 12
Hi Chris – I think it would fit, but be sure not to exceed the maximum fill line. Also, it will take a longer time for it to come to pressure. Enjoy!
Hi Barbara I wanted to let you know that I tried this wonderful recipe the other day & it was a winner. My husband and I like our soup slightly zesty but I didn’t have any spicy V-8 on hand...
I’m definitely trying this recipe. I think I will use Ro-Tel instead of the crushed tomatoes so I can give it a little extra spice. I’m excited to see what the family thinks.
Hi Abby – adding Ro-Tel sounds like a great idea. Enjoy!
….and if we used oxtails or beef neck what would the cooking time under pressure be? or would it turn the rice to mush? I am new to PC…and have a new Breville One Pot style cooker..
Hi Helen – you’d want to cook the oxtails or beef neck until they’re your desired tenderness and then continue to the recipe.
Is the rice pre-cooked?
Hi Chris – no, the rice isn’t pre-cooked.
That looks delicious Barbara. We do love our “soup night suppers” here. Bob would definitely like the Spicy V-8 too.

Hi Laura, can I substitute the tapioca flour for almond flour? Or coconut flour? Thanks :)
Dyan, the tapioca flour is the starchy base. There are no substitutions.

metatags.sub: At Monterrey-style Mexican restaurants these are made with fat red hot dogs and are called salchichas rojos. In Tucson, they are called Sonoran hot dogs. There are all sorts of variations, but the bacon-wrapped weiner is essential. Look for a small size bolillo or torpedo roll to keep the bread-to-meat ratio in line. For an easy summer BBQ menu, serve the dogs with Mexican Grilled Corn on the Cob.

usercomments.commenttext: These are the best chocolate bowls made that I have seen. You did an amazing job. Can’t wait to Try after seeing yours.

I have made these in the past, putting green dyed coconut and candy eggs so they looked like nests. I wish I would have sprayed them with cooking spray, some of the balloons stuck to the chocolate....
They should hold up as long as your chocolate bowls are thick enough. I would wait as long as possible to fill them so that the cheesecake filling doesn’t start to react to the chocolate...
make bowls so smartly! Thank you very much! :))
Hi there just wondering if you think these need to be refrigerated if I make them the day ahead? Also I have Wilton candy melts in hand, will these work and not require tempering?
Hi tonia, I tried this with the water balloons and baking chocolate with some colourants to make it orange. As soon as i dip it in the chocolate, the balloon pops… Any advice on what im doing wrong?
Hi Alicia! I have a couple of suggestions. Try cooling the baking chocolate for a while so that it isn’t so hot. And as I mentioned, I tried both water balloons and regular balloons and found...
There are awesome. I love it! This weekend my family will have a party, would probably be a surprise. Thanks for guide!
Thanks for sharing!!! Chocolate and berries is the best combination and these little bowls are so cute! Thanks for the tutorial. I never would have thought to use balloons to make the bowls!
You are very welcome! I need to make a Thanksgiving version!
I love this idea. Would it work if I just used regular melted chocolate chips? Or is there something special about the chocolate candiquik?
Hi Shannon, Yes, you can use regular melted chocolate chips. I have not tried that method but have seen others do it. You will need to temper the chocolate and possibly add shortening to the...
Perfect healthy dessert bowls! Absolutely it!!!
Question all the way from Australia: Substitution for Candiquik? Australian equivalent?
Greetings from America! I believe the Australian equivalent to Candiquik is called compound chocolate buttons or candy melts. Best of luck! ~Tonia
Most chocolate shops or baker’s supply stores (and some grocery stores) have melting chocolate of different forms, and these should work just fine. (and in my opinion are better than candiquick...
What a beautiful looking dessert – and such a brilliant, creative idea! I can’t wait to try this
These are so cute! I love the way they have a little base on the bottom. I thought you poured them into a mold or something, but it’s impressive how that happens on its own. Great party trick,...
What a fun idea!
Wow, these are so cool. I would have never thought to do this. I love it!
I’m gonna say it again – these are awesome and tons of fun! When I saw the pic on FB, I thought you actually dipped a bowl somehow, but I love the actual method…that base is so cool....
So darn clever! Love it!
I cannot wait to make these! These are awesome!
These are so cute, Tonia! I made little chick egg shells this Easter using a similar technique! I love the addition of fruit!
This is the coolest idea for a party. For our end of school party, I’m going to give these a try. Pinned!
These are absolutely stunning Tonia!
This looks so fun to make! And maybe even more fun to eat. Berries, cream, and chocolate is pretty much my ultimate summer dessert.
Wow, you executed these perfectly! What a terrific way to highlight the summer’s fruit!
Chocolate and berries is the best combination and these little bowls are so cute! Thanks for the tutorial. I never would have thought to use balloons to make the bowls!
I have always wanted to try this method but afraid it would fail! My daughter is right beside me as I read through your post and she is asking for balloons and chocolate now!
These are so awesome, I may try it with some of my low carb ingredients sometime!
Thank Carolyn! You really should!
These little bowls are adorable. Such a fun idea!
Great job Tonia!! You’ve made it look so easy – I’m totally doing this for our next party!
Thanks Martha! Everyone at the party was impressed!
Oh my god this is too awesome
Thanks so much Erin!

items.title: Best Crab Dip Ever

metatags.og:description: There are very few foods over which I lose control. However, there is something about this crab dip that turns me into a scoop and shove maniac. scoop, shove it in my mouth, repeat, repeat, repeatr…
metatags.og:title: Best Crab Dip Ever

wpheader.headline: That's Some Good Cookin'
wpheader.description: ...the best made is homemade...

usercomments.commenttext: I loovveee crab dip! Before app for a get together. Great recipe Happy Blogging! Happy Valley Chow
Thank you, Terri and have a Happy Friday.
You’re welcome and I hope that you have a great weekend, too.
I would be right there next to you shoveling this into my mouth. Looks like a real deal delicious dip. Have a great weekend!
Come on over, let’s start shoveling!
Holy-Moly!! What a tasty looking dip….and a “light” version to boot! I am one of the many who feel guilty at times when I over-indulge……which is often. I know this will be a hit for...
Yay for the girls!
You had me at crab – add cocktail sauce too, and wow! Love that you were able to reduce the fat and calories. Thanks for sharing your tip on which crab to buy – can’t wait to give this a try.
Teri, I love your recipes and I love you! Your kindness and brightness is very apparent in everything you write and cook. Thank you for sharing.
Thank you, Shari. I’m totally blushing (or is it a hot flash?) over your compliment. Thanks dropping by!
Hi Terri, My aunt has made something very similar to this for years and it is a family favorite. She calls it “Crab Pizza” ! The only difference is she sprinkles the crab meat on top of...
Hi Scott. I like the way your aunt’s version sounds with layering some of the ingredients. Her idea definitely makes for a nicer presentation. Something has been bugging me about the way...
Bought a store brand crab dip that was blah. Landed on this recipe looking for a way to spice it up. No more store brand for me. This recipe has just the right zing!
Yes! I’m so glad that you liked this. It is my favorite crab dip. Have a happy New Year! ~Terri
Do you drain the juice from the lump crabmeat in a can?
Heather, yes.

items.htmlTitle: Thai Salmon Fillets With Cucumber Salsa - Recipes | Pampered ...

metatags.og:recipeinstructions: For salmon and marinade, finely chop gingerroot using Food Chopper. Combine gingerroot, sesame oil, cilantro, salt and black pepper in Small Batter Bowl; mix well. Place salmon fillets in resealable plastic bag; add marinade and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes or up to 6 hours. For salsa, using Food Chopper, chop cucumber, bell pepper, onion and jalapeño pepper. Using Classic Scraper, place vegetables in Classic Batter Bowl. Press garlic into Batter Bowl using Garlic Press. Add vinegar, oil, sugar and salt; mix well. Preheat oven to 400°F. Remove fillets from plastic bag and place in Rectangular Baker; discard marinade. Bake 15-20 minutes or until salmon turns opaque and flakes easily with a fork. Serve with salsa.
metatags.title: Thai Salmon Fillets With Cucumber Salsa - Recipes | Pampered Chef US Site
metatags.og:name: Thai Salmon Fillets With Cucumber Salsa
metatags.og:description: A crunchy cucumber salsa, with just a bit of heat from a jalapeño pepper, is a fresh and spirited contrast to the mildly seasoned baked salmon.
metatags.og:ingredients: Salmon & Marinade 1 tablespoon peeled fresh gingerroot, finely chopped 2 tablespoons sesame oil 1 tablespoon snipped fresh cilantro 1/4 teaspoon salt 1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper 1 1/2 pounds salmon fillets Salsa 1 cup cucumber, chopped 1/4 cup red bell pepper, chopped 1/4 cup red onion, chopped 1 jalapeño pepper, seeded and finely chopped 1 garlic clove, pressed 3 tablespoons rice vinegar 2 tablespoons vegetable oil 1/4 teaspoon sugar 1/8 teaspoon salt

Yum! Glad you liked it Lottie.
Thanks so much for the recipe.It was delicious. I used smoked salmon, prawns, cod and halibut. Oh so good. Love you Jamie. You are the best! Larry
Glad you liked it!
Oh this is delicious! Loved it!
So glad you liked it Martha!
Oh my! this was yummy. Used potatoe and leek topping and used flounder, cod and prawns to make up the fish part but the sauce was absolutely scrummy AND we have enough to freeze!!
Yes, this freezes beautifully. So glad you liked it Jackie.
This was delicious!
So glad you liked it Nick.

what could I use besides hake and haddock? I live in NorCal and we have different fish here like halibut, cod, etc.
Carole, you could use any smoked fish instead of the haddock. You could also use salmon, trout, monkfish, etc. Try to firm, sustainable fish in this pie.
Thanks Alida, will do. This reminds me of a fish pie my Finnish mom used to make, called “lox-lova.”
This sounds amazing, I want to make it tonight. I love Jamie, and I’m a real New England fish pie lover as well. The green color is beautiful, too!
I’m sure you’ll love this pie! It’s incredibly delicious!

It is so absolutely delicious!

metatags.og:description: Chef Robert Irvine heads to The Main Dish in Meridianville, Ala., where he finds a family desperate for help. Owners Lynn and Ken bought the restaurant five years earlier because Ken loved to cook, but with no restaurant experience at all, the couple is now working 80 hours a week and in more than $50,000 debt.   FN Dish Update: See How The Main Dish Is Doing

metatags.og:description: Baking pork chops in this sauce will make them perfectly tender and melt-in-your-mouth good. The sauce features onions, garlic, and allspice to add flavor and the meat is simmered in chicken broth, balsamic vinegar, and tomato juice so that the pork chops come out perfectly tender and juicy. The mashed buttercup squash is easy to make and our Cabot Extra Sharp Cheddar adds a delightful cheesy taste that perfectly complements the rich sauce on the pork chops. Be sure to rate and review the dish once you have given it a try. We love hearing feedback on our recipes, so please feel free to share any comments or tips!  Trying out new side dishes is a great way to put a fresh spin on a favorite entrée. This delicious mashed cheddar buttercup squash dish is a perfect complement to our tasty pork chop recipe. Pork chops have been a favorite dinner dish for generations of families, and our twist on this classic dish features a velvety mushroom sauce over perfectly tender roasted pork chops. comment.text: Is there no oil in the recipe for the dressing for the Apple Cranberry Walnut Salad? The dressing “looks” like it has oil in it in the picture.

Hello….what kind of oil do you use? Canola?
I used extra virgin olive oil.
Thank you….do you think Canola would be ok too?
The BOWL! IT’S AMAZING! I mean wait, the salad, it’s amazing!! They can’t compete, really. They just work, like salt and pepper, caramel and apple. Gorgeous photos, as always Tiffany!...
Yummy! I have eaten this salad combo for a few years now, but I use blue cheese , candied nuts and occasionally pears. I am excited for a dressing change-up though. This recipe sounds like...
This is a very good article. Thank you for a great information. I like to eat salad.
Hahaha – when my brother was a kid, he convinced my aunt that he was ALLERGIC to “green stuff”…and she BELIEVED him. I really don’t know why kids don’t enjoy the beauty of salad!...
I love a good salad and apples and walnuts are one of my favorite combinations. When the neighbor girl grows up, hopefully she will develop a taste for leaves. There are so many types and flavors!
This looks like a wonderful fall recipe! Planning on making it for Thanksgiving dinner at my in-laws. Do you recommend making it the day of so the apples don’t go bad? Or how far in advance...
This sounds absolutely fabulous! I’m going to make it tonight to have with homemade pizza.
Oh this would go perfectly with pizza!!
Hi! Do you think I could use Apple Cider instead of Apple Juice?! I can’t have apple juice b/c of the sugar. I know it’ll taste different but didn’t know if you would think it’d be...
Did you use all of the dressing you made? A cup and a half of dressing seems like a lot for just 6 cups of greens.
You can use as much or as little dressing as you like!
Nice recipe and nice to have a homemade dressing to go with this salad. Thank you, Lynn
This salad looks amazing. Plus I like the fact that it is fairly healthy. Pinned to my “Taste of Fall” board.
Making this today for Thanksgiving.
I’m making this for thanksgiving today too!
Made this today, and reduced the apple juice to only 2 tablespoons. I prefer the thicker vinaigrette style.
Great salad, thanks! Maybe have the recipe moved to the top of the article.
i just made this for thanksgiving, delicious! Thanks for the recipe!
I like your dressing recipe. People love these kinds of salads, don’t they? I’ve linked to your recipe on my weekend healthy recipes roundup, and can’t wait to give it a try.
Ummm thanks for this I love the pictures and everything seems delicious, will try with a new raw honey I just bought http://www.tiana-coconut.com/products/organic-honey/ it is not easy to spread...
Hi! Love this recipe. I’m currently in the process of making a personal blog and I wanted to feature this recipe. Of course I will give you recognition =D Just seeking your permission? Thanks...
Hi! So glad you like this salad recipe – you may feature one of my images without the recipe – with proper credit and a link leading readers back to the recipe on my site.
So beautiful. This dish will new color and new taste to my diet cook book. Thank you for the recipe!
YUM! this looks so pretty and delicious! I love how fresh it is!
Thanks for sharing this yummy apple cranberry walnut. I’m sure my teenagers will love this if i’ll give it a try at home.
Hey – amazing recipe and site, buuuuuut you seem to have ads with noise enabled, but not visible anywhere!! One of the most annoying things on any blog is not being able to turn the sound...
Hi Rose! Gah, I am SO sorry for that obnoxious audio – I am looking into it right this minute and will try to get it fixed as quickly as possible! Thanks for your patience and support!
I really liked this salad; I attempted the dressing but something seemed off about it as I was making it and I didn’t end up enjoying it. The flavors are good, but there is way too much apple...
I’m so glad you photographed this gorgeous salad, Tiffany!, it’s perfection for fall! I’m sure all these girls are now in love with salad.
I really cannot imagine a meal without salad. The first thing I look for is acid, for a refreshing taste. at the same time, I like to make it a little sweeter, just for balance. Also, I like...
In the apple walnut salad if you use poppyseed dressing, how much do you use?
It’s totally up to you Lynn! I like a lot of dressing, I think I usually use about 1/2 cup. You can always add more if you need so maybe start with 1/3 cup and go from there!
it sounds delicious and beautiful and i will make it.
Made this for a lunch at work to go with a Turkey & Cranberry Sandwich. It was delicious! Hands down the best salad of this kind I have ever tasted. The only thing I did alter was I only used...
Yay! Isn’t this salad the best?? I never get tired of it and neither does my family – so glad you enjoyed it Jennifer!!
Yum! My mom makes a salad similar to this, so I knew I would like it. It turned out delicious. I followed the recipe exactly and used canola oil in the dressing. Just a heads up – the dressing...
The dressing is too sweet and watery, but the salad is good.

comment.text: I’ve always though Starbucks sandwiches were way too small and bland for what hey priced them at, but I think that’s part of what Starbucks is known for I’ve never had the original but...
At another airport, I had their turkey and swiss and it was so bad. SO BAD.
i was thinking you were going to make a paleo wrap for us. LOL!… get on that! jk. But seriously, looks so good!
For us two, I shall
YES! I’m starting a new job soon where I’ll have to do more on-the-go breakfasts, and this looks perfect for that. Can’t wait to try making this.
This is so good, Jess- Definitely NOT like the ones at Starbucks haha
I’ve always thought that their feta wrap looked SO good but I was iffy about the ingredients!
Definitely try this out!
Yum! Did you know this is my favorite sandwich at Starbucks? I never want to splurge on them though.
No I didn’t, now here’s a recipe for you!
Gorgeous wrap! I’m a big sun dried tomato fan….looks so fresh and tempting!
Thanks Allie!
Ooooo. I won’t even bother trying the Starbucks version now that you’ve posted this recipe. I’ll bring your version into Starbucks and make other people jealous. The peanut butter supreme...
LOL!! Not even kidding you, I proclaimed the same thing. I think the ingredients had ALMONDS in it.
It totally does have almonds in it!!
Spinach and Feta cheese together is like a match made in heaven! This is my kind of breakfast – healthy and delicious!
Thanks Abigail- It’s delicious and SUCH a good combo!
AHH! Don’t tell me the s’mores oreos are bad! I just bought a box today
I wasn’t a fan
OMG AMAZING!!!
Thanks Linz!
I saw this post flash across my FB feed this morning, and I have to say I’ve thought about it all day. While I haven’t tried the “real” one, I think I’m just going to use yours as...
Please do, Kim- It’s delicious!
Looks very yummy!
Thank you!
I’dtake your version anyway…especially if there’s no skimping on the feta! Starbucks should stick with making baked goods which actually taste great. I don’t think I’ve ever bought...
DON’t. omg. I have to tell you my turkey and cheddar story. That was even worse.
Arman, this is what I want for lunch. I’ve never tried the Starbucks version, but I am sure this is better! Sounds wonderful my friend. Have a great day, Catherine
Thanks Catherine- It is much tastier and cheaper too
Would you believe that I’ve never tried the Starbucks Spinach and Feta Breakfast Wrap? But I am a HUGE fan of feta cheese (we go through it like crazy in our house), so I’m pretty sure...
Dude. If you were to try it, it would insult your tastebuds. Urgh. First you leave me craving ruebens, then falafel and now an egg sandwich. The rotisserie chicken looks dismal.
I love that you bumped up the flavor and size of that wrap! Yours looks amazing and so much better than those small things they sell in coffee shops!!!
Thanks so much
So HAPPY to have found this!!! I always order this at Starbucks but never thought of making it at home. Thank you!
Very welcome
I guess I am one of the lucky one that had never tried this ‘fantastic’ wrap at Starbucks. But again, I write from Amsterdam. Here Starbuck does not get very adventurous. On the other hand...
Hahaha definitely lucky mate! Ohhh Amsterdam? I would be insulted if you chose anything edible from Starbucks- You’ve left me craving chips and mayo!
I rarely ever go to Starbucks so can’t say I’ve ever tried their food. However, YOUR version I will try! With a boatload of feta too – can’t get enough of that stuff.
Thanks Mermaid! DON’T go to Starbucks…except for coffee
I can’t believe how many healthy food bloggers like Starbucks wraps! Personally I would not have recommended you go there for any meal first thing in NY. Next time you need a restaurant rec...
Right??????? Haha, it was actually an airport meal, I’m fortunate to be able to distinguish some decent places here! I LOVE alphabet city for random food choices!
I’m shocked people recommended Starbucks as a healthy food option. Anything that comes with a text book of ingredients is the opposite of good eats, in my not so humble opinion. Your version,...
YESSSS. If I made this for you, I’d add smashed potatoes too
I hate to be that person but I honestly just don’t like Starbucks. The food and the coffee are always mediocre and I feel so ripped off paying such a huge price tag for something that doesn’t...
Don’t hate to be that person- I completely agree on all parts Seriously, I don’t get what they call ‘feta’
This would be a terrific lunch for me!
Definitely!
Those look incredible. Starbucks Wraps are TINY!!!!! Never enough, not even with a large coffee. Urgent question from a burrito lover: how do you make the tortilla stay wraped?
ooo I didn’t use a tortilla- I used a flatbread like a lavash?
I love that wrap but I’m totally with you – you need at least two to feel satisfied. Yours looks way more filling and delicious. In fact, you’ve made me hungry enough to go make one…and...
Thanks buddy! Enjoy
Sundried tomatoes make everything better. And cheese. Lots of cheese. Looks delicious!!
Thanks Jess! PS- I couldn’t comment on any of your posts I wanted to say we shared a bowl haircut!
Wait that’s so bizarre!! I’m sad you couldn’t comment on them…I wonder why…darn technology. Yay for childhood twinning!!!
This sounds so yummy! Also the story leading up to the creation of this wrap was hilarious. Pinning!
hahaha thanks so much Sam!
Your wrap looks delicious! I noticed that the ingredients list at Starbucks includes cream cheese. Is there a reason you left it out of yours?
Hi Janette- Honestly, I couldn’t even taste it in the wrap so simply omitted it
This looks so yummy! How long do these last for in the freezer [wondering how many can be made in advance]. Do you have any suggestions for easy reheating in the morning? Thanks!!
Hi Haylee! I usually make them in batches of 6 or 7 and they last a good month- For reheating, I either thaw it the night before in the fridge and reheat in a sandwich press or if I use good...
Looks SO good! Ok where can I find gluten free lavash wraps? What brand do you use? Also, to freeze, do you just put them individually in plastic bags? Do you wrap them first? Thanks!
Hi Lacy! I’ve used a couple, my favourite brand Flatout just released a range of gluten free ones! I actually wrap them individually in grease proof paper and then wrap them again in aluminium foil!

I was craving chicken cesar wraps. I remembered I saved this recipe. It was delicious! !!!
How long can you store this before serving and could you freeze it?

comment.text: Looks like a great snack. Much better looking than chex mix, I might add.
Would Annie’s cheddar powder work in a pinch? Say, if I felt compelled to make this today and not wait for Amazon shipping?
For sure!!! You might have to cannibalize two boxes for it, though!
Do you let it cool before you add the cheese powder? I’ve re-read it a few times and seem to be missing that part. Sounds yummy!! Can’t wait to try it!!
Hi there! Actually, it’s best to toss it on while the cereal is still hot. It sticks better that way!
I love that you took shredded wheat and turned it into a snack. Normally I just shove them in my mouth plain but why do plain when you can do cheddar and garlic?
Chex mix was only for the holidays. It was made the day after Thanksgiving because you needed to the use the large roasting pan to hold it all, and the pan was out. My brother has taken on...
This looks like a snack my husband would love! We wait every year for his grandparents to make their chex mix! My husband usually eats the whole batch! Looks delicious!
Such a great idea to take a cereal and make something completely different and fun to munch on.
Oh yum!!!!!! Will definitely have to try these.:)
All I need is the cheddar cheese powder to make this! I loved chex mix as a kid…so cool that you used shredded wheat.
I love this! You just take your favorite element of chex mix and leave out the rest. Your seasoning sounds to die for!
Love that you used shredded wheat!! GENIUS!
My kids love shredded wheat (I have weird kids), but I tend to turn my nose up when it comes to it. This is definitely changing my mind though. Cheese? Yes! Garlic? You don’t have to tell me twice!
How unusual! Love the mixture and wouldn’t that just go great with a beer?
Ohmygoodness, yes. I must make more because I have beer in the fridge!
Lordy this looks amazing! Excellent photography as always! Can’t wait to make this , thanks for sharing
I’ve never really eaten Chex mix but I think this might make me a convert. It looks amazing!
Oh man, this looks good!
I am racking my brain over here trying to remember whether or not I’ve ever eaten shreddedwheat in my chex mix – I don’t think I have(!?). That’s changing, pronto! And I’m making...
Using Shredded Wheat as a snack mix ingredient is all kinds of brilliant!
I love this homemade version of an old family favorite. This is definitely going to be a staple at holiday time!
I can hear the crunch in my ears just by looking at your photos! YUMMY!
My pantry loves you right now Rebecca – this, the Cool Ranch Doritos, Homemade Ranch Mix – I’ve been bookmarking like crazy!
SUPER yummy, thanks so much for the recipe!

A good bowl like this scares all my worries away – this is definite comfort food for me. Yum!
